119A.description: Authors from the first half of the 19th century. Romantic poetry and drama. Balzac, Stendhal and the novel. Michelet and the emergence of history.
119A.title: Nineteenth-Century Literature

171B.description: An examination of certain large cultural concepts, such as "the Baroque" or "Romanticism," in French cultural history. Topics vary from year to year.
171B.title: A Concept in French Cultural History

251.description: Focuses upon the relationship between oral and written cultures in Francophone Africa and/or the Caribbean: lyric and narrative poetry, drama and novels; the presence of oral tradition in written forms, narrative techniques borrowed from storytelling tradition, the definition of traditional metaphors and imagery; idealization of lost worlds; the conflict of traditional culture and modernism; the search for political identity and independence.
251.title: Francophone Literature

3.description: Building on foundation established in first year, trains students in listening, reading, writing, and speaking French. Review and refinement of grammar.
3.title: Intermediate French

151B.description: A study of Francophone literature: traditional and French influences, structure, relationship between language and message.
151B.title: Francophone Literature

102.description: An exploration of the ways words and images structure thought, communication and interactions of the subject and society. Development of reading and writing skills leading to correct and effective expression in French.
102.title: Reading and Writing Skills in French

H195B.description: Students will write an essay on a topic relating to French literature or culture under the supervision of a member of the faculty during two semesters of their senior year.
H195B.title: Honors Sequence

197.description: Supervised field programs involving experiences in schools and school-related activities. Regular individual meetings with faculty sponsor and written reports required.
197.title: Field Studies

210B.description: Offerings vary from year to year. Students should consult the Department's <Course Description> for current topics.
210B.title: Studies in Medieval Literature

13.description: Intermediate French conversation. May not be repeated for credit.
13.title: Intermediate Conversation

299.description: Reserved for students directly engaged in writing the doctoral thesis.
299.title: Individual Research

265B.description: Offerings vary from year to year. See the department's course description for current topic.
265B.title: Modern Studies

180D.description: Survey of French civilization: history, arts, and society, through the interpretation of literary texts. 180A: The Middle Ages; 180B: The Ancien Regime; 180C: The 19th Century; 180D: The 20th Century.
180D.title: French Civilization

R1B.description: This course is designed to fulfill the second half of the Reading and Composition requirement. The primary goal of this course is to develop students' reading and writing skills through a series of assignments that will provide them with the opportunity to formulate observations made in class discussions into coherent argumentative essays. Emphasis will be placed on the refinement of effective sentence, paragraph, and thesis formation, keeping in mind the notion of writing as a process. Other goals in this course are a familiarization with French literature and the specific questions that are relevant to this field. In addition, students will be introduced to different methods of literary and linguistic analysis in their nonliterary readings.
R1B.title: English Composition in Connection with the Reading of Literature

140D.description: Major texts of modern French literature. Readings and writing assignments in English for non-majors; in French for French majors and minors. Class discussions in English.
140D.title: French Literature in English Translation

126.description: Intensive study of a major author.
126.title: Senior Seminar

178B.description: Topics vary from year to year.
178B.title: Studies in French Film

103B.description: Discussion and composition based on the analysis of literary and cultural texts.
103B.title: Language and Culture

1.description: Introduction to speaking, listening, reading, and writing in French.
1.title: Elementary French

H195A.description: Students will write an essay on a topic relating to French literature or culture under the supervision of a member of the faculty during two semesters of their senior year.
H195A.title: Honors Sequence

2.description: Introduction to speaking, listening, reading, and writing in French. Continuation of French 1.
2.title: Elementary French

14.description: Advanced French conversation. This course may not be repeated for credit.
14.title: Advanced Conversation

4.description: Advanced training in listening, reading, writing, and speaking French. Review and refinement of grammar.
4.title: Advanced Intermediate French

161B.description: The study of a year in French history from many points of view--political, sociological, intellectual, and artistic, as well as literary.
161B.title: A Year in French History

R1A.description: This course is designed to fulfill the first half of the Reading and Composition requirement. The primary goal of this course is to develop students' reading and writing skills through a series of assignments that will provide them with the opportunity to formulate observations made in class discussions into coherent argumentative essays. Emphasis will be placed on the refinement of effective sentence, paragraph, and thesis formation, keeping in mind the notion of writing as a process. Other goals in this course are a familiarization with French literature and the specific questions that are relevant to this field. In addition, students will be introduced to different methods of literary and linguistic analysis in their nonliterary readings.
R1A.title: English Composition in Connection with the Reading of Literature

298.description: Designed for students engaged in exploration of a restricted field, involving the writing of a report. May not be substituted for available graduate courses.
298.title: Special Study

302.description: Bi-weekly lectures on methodology, grading and testing in French 2. Demonstration class with required attendance five times per week; laboratory observations; supervised classroom practice. Additional seminars and discussion sections on methodology. Required for all Graduate Student Instructors teaching French 2 for the first time.
302.title: Teaching French in College: Advanced First Year

117A.description: Authors from the first half of the 17th century. The Baroque; its chief exponents, literary attempts to resolve the crisis in Renaissance values, formulation of new concepts in philosophy and psychology, experiments with traditional forms in poetry, fiction, and the theatre. Preciosity, Descartes, and rationalism.
117A.title: Seventeenth-Century Literature

199.description: Enrollment restricted according to College regulations. Individual instruction only in areas not covered by courses.
199.title: Supervised Independent Study and Research for Advanced Undergraduates

35.description: This multimedia course concentrates on pronunciation and listening comprehension skills and provides a new understanding of the French language. Course Web site includes a wide variety of material--text, audio, or video, authentic or specifically recorded for the course--an audio-visual sound chart, and a multimedia reference section. International phonetic alphabet and theoretical concepts are taught as necessary. Strongly recommended before study, work, or travel in French- speaking countries, particulariy for Education Abroad Program students. Course required for French majors and minors in French Language Studies.
35.title: Practical Phonetics and Listening Comprehension

303.description: Lectures and discussion on the methodologies used in teaching second-year French, grading and testing; occasional attendance at demonstration classes; language laboratory observations; supervised classroom teaching. Required of all instructors teaching French 3 or 4.
303.title: Teaching French in College: Second Year

245B.description: Offerings vary from year to year. See the department's course description for current topic.
245B.title: Early Modern Studies

120B.description: Development of the novel, poetry, and theatre since the Second World War. Sartre and existentialism, theatre of the absurd, nouveau roman.
120B.title: Twentieth-Century Literature

275A.description: Offerings vary from year to year. See the Department's <Course Description> for current topics.
275A.title: Problems of Literary Theory
